name: msgid
description: RFC 4122 Unique identifier for this message.  Generated by ais-tools from source, nmea and tagblock_timestamp

name: source
description: The source provider (spire, orbcomm, exactearth, etc)

name: type
description: The AIS message type, the format is [AIS.type]

name: ssvid
description: Source-Specific Vessel ID.   For AIS, this is the MMSI

name: timestamp
description: This is the unix timestamp for the time the message was received by the original receiver.  You should use this as the effective timestamp for the message

name: callsign
description: Radio call sign of the MMSI-registered vessel

name: receiver
description: Identifier for the specific receiver if available

name: length
description: The length of the boat in meters

name: width
description: The width of the boat in meters

name: class_b_cs_flag
description: Set to 1 if the message is a type 18 message with unit_flag=1 which indicates that it is a Carrier Sense (CS) device.  Set to 0 for type 18 messages which are not CS (meaning that they are SOTDMA) and set to NULL for all other message types
